sinks.name: memset
sinks.reason: Write destination may be shared memory or invalid; tainted pointer can cause writes into Normal World-accessible or unintended memory

sinks.name: memset
sinks.reason: Tainted size can cause out-of-bounds writes or excessive writes into shared or secure memory

sinks.name: platform_add_device_to_region
sinks.reason: size/length controls region range; missing validation could cause integer overflow or OOB region table access

sinks.name: platform_add_device_to_region
sinks.reason: base address combined with size to compute end; insufficient checks can cause overflow or invalid mapping

sinks.name: platform_add_device_to_region
sinks.reason: unvalidated region/index could cause out-of-bounds access to region table

sinks.name: platform_create_region
sinks.reason: Potential source buffer used for initialization may be copied into a region; tainted pointer could cause out-of-bounds read or data exfiltration if region is shared

sinks.name: platform_create_region
sinks.reason: Tainted size controls allocation/copy length; risk of integer overflow, over-allocation, or overflow during initialization

sinks.name: platform_create_region
sinks.reason: Tainted attributes/flags could mark the region as shared with Normal World, leading to unencrypted output/exposure

sinks.name: platform_destroy_region
sinks.reason: Tainted region pointer/handle could cause invalid dereference, double-free/unmap, or memory corruption if not validated

sinks.name: platform_dump_device
sinks.reason: Destination/output buffer may be in Normal World shared memory; writing dump data can exfiltrate secrets and cause overflow if size validation is missing

sinks.name: platform_dump_device
sinks.reason: Size/length controls how much data is copied; tainted size can cause out-of-bounds writes or excessive leakage

sinks.name: platform_dump_device
sinks.reason: Selector/offset/region identifier can direct dumping of unintended secure memory or devices, enabling unauthorized disclosure

sinks.name: platform_dump_status
sinks.reason: Output destination or format/buffer pointer could route sensitive status data to Normal World or shared memory, causing info-leak

sinks.name: platform_dump_status
sinks.reason: Size/length parameter may enable buffer overflow or out-of-bounds write if not strictly validated

sinks.name: platform_dump_status
sinks.reason: Additional size/offset or source parameter could influence the amount of data copied or printed, leading to memory corruption or info-leak

sinks.name: strcmp
sinks.reason: Unbounded read of potentially attacker-controlled string pointer may lead to out-of-bounds read or side-channel leakage if not NUL-terminated within bounds

sinks.reason: Unbounded read of potentially attacker-controlled string pointer may lead to out-of-bounds read or side-channel leakage if not NUL-terminated within bounds
